So, ---

 

Whenever I place landing gear on my fuselage it goes on upside down.  I'm forced to play around with the dang rotate controls for 5 minutes every time I try to move them.  Snap-to on or off does not help.

Am I missing something in placement or is this a bug?

51 minutes ago, Zpike said:

So, ---

 

Whenever I place landing gear on my fuselage it goes on upside down.  I'm forced to play around with the dang rotate controls for 5 minutes every time I try to move them.  Snap-to on or off does not help.

Am I missing something in placement or is this a bug?

Landing gear should attach to the bottom of the fuselage the right way round by default. So in the SPH, with angle snap on, if you add a fuel tank without rotating it and then add landing gear to that, it should all be correct. Likewise with landing legs in the VAB: they should attach to a non-rotated fuel tank the right way up.

However, if you rotate a part and then add landing gear/legs to that rotated part, it will be rotated the same way.

And if you try to add landing legs in the SPH, they will want to attach the same way as in the VAB: probably not what you wanted. And getting them rotated correctly is a huge PITA.

And if you add landing gear to wings, they'll be 90° off for some reason that I haven't really understood. Not sure if it's really a "bug"; probably more like "coding this so that it attaches the right way is actually more complicated that you'd think, so it's been left like this".
It's generally easier to use WASDQE to rotate landing gear 90° before attaching it to wings. One press (S, I think, but I never remember) should be all you need.

 

Edited October 13, 2016 by Plusck
When you select your rotation gizmo, try hitting the F key to turn on "absolute rotation mode". It may help getting the gear into the orientation you want.
Thanks for the tips all.   Giving it a try now.
